_header: Toforn love have I played at the chess
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, On the Loss of his Mistress, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 118) — three 9-line stanzas (ababbcddc) and 4-line Envoy

BLHar682.First Lines:
TOforne loue haue y pleyd at the chesseTo passe the tyme with cursid
                    false daungere…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…For shulde y thenke rekewre me now nay nayWithout so be y
                    make a lady newe
BLHar682.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 682.
